reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights, a Saturday and a Sunday, recently with my wife. It was a getaway before the birth of our first baby. And boy, did we make the right choice.
reviews.title: 5 Star All the Way

likes.liked: — Every person who works here seems to genuinely care about the guests.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we got out of our car to the moment they packed our trunk when we left, we were treated like royalty.
reviews.title: Classy Comfort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start at the beginning.
reviews.title: Super Guest Services!

reviews.text: The room was great. The furniture may be an older style, but everything was in immaculate condition and perfect working order. Very, very comfortable. The staff set up a DVD player for us in our room, no problem. The bed was heavenly, and robes were provided without us having to ask. The room, the bathroom…even the balcony, everything was extremely clean. Carpet was nice and thick and the hotel seems to have gone through a renovation recently. On our 2nd day, one of the staff noticed we had put some beverages (too large to fit in the minibar) on the balcony to stay cool, and they brought in a small fridge, and moved our beverages into it. Wow, that's service!
reviews.title: Not Impressed

reviews.text: Truffles Restaurant. Dinner on our first night. I believe this is the only 5 star restaurant in Toronto and it lives up to that rating. Both the service and the food were beyond excellent. When I asked for something not on the menu, it was no problem. When my wife requested a special dessert because of a medical condition, no problem. The staff even mentioned that they'd spoken to the chef about it and the chef had ensured the main course ingredients were tailored slightly to fit her special diet.
reviews.title: Immaculate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were guests of the hotel for 3 nights (June 13-16 ) while attending a wedding which also took place there. We had a special rate of approximately $235.00.
reviews.title: Wonderful Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are repeat visitors and have been to the hotel 3 times previously. Perhaps that is the explanation for the upgrade to a deluxe room with king size bed.
reviews.title: LOVE this hotel!

reviews.text: I agree with many that the service is very good. I had neglected to make a brunch reservation on Father's day to celebrate that as well as my daughter's birthday. No problem: a call a few days before to the hotel resulted in us having a table at Avenues for brunch despite the restaurant being full. Avenues is a gorgeous contemporary room- furnished beautifully, great art, and lovely and accomodating service (can't decide between the crab cake and the French toast? we'll give you both), but the food was disappointing.
reviews.title: The secret is the service...

reviews.text: We were even escorted to the elevator several times. Many of our wedding weekend clothes were creased as a result of packing. Again, no problem .They were whisked off to be pressed - beautifully - and returned promptly at the time requested. But note a huge price of over $100.00 for 4 garments.
reviews.title: The Place to stay at Toronto

likes.liked: — The personal, friendly and attentive staff

reviews.text: I also agree with many that the rooms are very ho hum. They are somewhat dated and are uninspiring. Our bathroom was very small and I don't believe that any 5 star hotel truly earns the honour if they offer a vinyl shower curtain. Moreover, we had to call for toiletries that were not restocked as well. Much apologizing about that omission. Turn down service every night, but sadly no chocolate.
reviews.title: ok, but not up to four seasons standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Let's start with the obvious - it is a Four Seasons hotel, so in general the service was very good. The trade-off for that is always that the Four Seasons' rooms are small imho.
reviews.title: Would Someone Please buy Room Service More Carts/Trays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What was unusual this trip was the room service. First, no-one picked up the telephone when I called for room service, very odd. Second, the room service clerk called three times on Sunday morning to ask to remove our breakfast tray. If the hotel is that short of breakfast trays, perhaps the hotel should invest in more trays.
reviews.title: Four Season tries hard.

likes.disliked: — The pet policy and the outdated decor.

reviews.text: Other than that very minor comment, we enjoyed our Four Seasons' stay including the warm welcome from Florencia at the front desk.
reviews.title: Still the best in Toronto's big hotels

likes.disliked: — Not all rooms have good views

reviews.text: I'll keep this short and sweet.
reviews.title: Not worth the price

reviews.text: The Four Seasons Toronto is an aging 5-star hotel. You can see how it would've been a classic, 5-star hotel in, say, the 80's. But it was desperately in need of updating, when I stayed there.
reviews.title: Five and A Half Seasons
More like "One Season" vs "Four Seasons".
reviews.text: My wife and I are huge fans for the Four Season's and could not wait to stay at their flagship Canadian property in Toronto (their corporate headquarters). The staff was professional, curtious and knowledgable. However the hotel is extremely out of date. The bathrooms are in desperate need of an upgrade. The furniture was old and the rooms were worn-out. The concierge was the high point. They made several restaurant recommendations that were terrific. I read the reviews on this website before I made our reservations. Frankly, I did not trust them. I thought there is no way that the Four Season's flagship property is that out of date. Well...I will never make that mistake again.

reviews.title: Exquisite service in a slightly ageing hotel
reviews.text: Location and staff are great. Perfect Four Season's quality. Unfortunately, the hotel is not worth the money.

My wife and i stayed from a Thursday night to a Sunday and really enjoyed the hotel. It is a 35 year old property and that means smaller bathrooms than newer hotels, but the room was lovely. The service from check in to departure was absolutely exceptional. Room service was fast ,courteous with very tasty food.
reviews.title: Three and a half seasons

likes.disliked: — rooms needed to be freshened up a bit

reviews.text: The pool area is small and older but the service was again excellent.
reviews.title: No way

likes.disliked: — Outdated and very overpriced for what you get

reviews.text: Restaurants were friendly and efficient.
reviews.title: One of my favorite FS properties!
